It was a trade that was part of a wholesale change in Edmonton’s nets that NHL insiders said was highly improbable, such was the difficulty of making such drastic moves in-season. articles.title: Gold Falls After Trump Backs Away From Tariffs Over Greenland
articles.description: Gold fell after US President Donald Trump withdrew a threat to impose tariffs on European nations and said a “framework of a future deal” over Greenland had been agreed.

articles.title: Fizzy Drinks Maker Chi Forest Is Said to Consider Hong Kong IPO
articles.description: Chi Forest, a maker of low-calorie sparkling drinks and flavored teas, is considering a Hong Kong initial public offering, people familiar with the matter said, following in the footsteps of other Chinese beverage companies.

articles.title: Woman suffering from cancer says long wait times in B.C. may have contributed to her terminal diagnosis
articles.description: A B.C. mother says that her terminal cancer diagnosis could have been different if she had not to wait two months to see an oncologist.

articles.title: Australia observes day of mourning for victims of Bondi Beach mass shooting
articles.description: Flags will be flown at half-staff to honour the victims of the December 14 shooting at Sydney's Bondi Beach.

articles.title: Trump says 'framework of a future deal' discussed on Greenland as he backs off tariffs threat
articles.description: At Davos, the US president said he would not use force to take the island and later floated a possible "forever" deal.

articles.title: Deja vu? Marie-Philip Poulin scores in OT as Victoire beat Frost 2-1
articles.description: Marie-Philip Poulin scored a goal in overtime and the Montreal Victoire beat the Minnesota Frost 2-1 on Wednesday night. articles.description: Dylan Larkin scored at 3:08 of overtime as the Detroit Red Wings downed the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 on Wednesday night.

articles.title: World’s oldest cave art discovered in Indonesia’s Muna island
articles.description: Indonesia and the surrounding region is known for some of the world's most ancient archaeological finds.

articles.title: A Carter George goal helps Sault Ste. Marie to a win over the London Knights
articles.description: The Soo Greyhounds defeated the London Knights 5-2 as Carter George scored his second OHL goal.

articles.title: A look at some potential candidates for the Coalition Avenir Québec leadership
articles.description: The upcoming leadership race is the first in the CAQ's history, as Legault co-founded the party in 2011 and has served as its only leader.

articles.title: Israel bombs four Syria-Lebanon border crossings; kills 2 in south Lebanon
articles.description: Lebanese President Joseph Aoun blasts Israeli 'policy of systematic aggression' that directly targets civilians.

articles.title: Man accused in stabbing, injuring Abbotsford laundromat owner awaits sentencing
articles.description: Timothy Richard Louis Rowley, 41, was initially charged with assault with a weapon and aggravated assault in the Aug. 9, 2025, incident.

articles.title: Marineland now seeking permits to ship remaining belugas to U.S.: sources
articles.description: TORONTO — Marineland has presented a plan to the federal government to ship the last remaining captive whales and dolphins in Canada to several institutions in the United States, The Canadian Press has learned. articles.title: Despite risk of encampment fires, City of Penticton has limited capacity to act
articles.description: According to the fire chief, crews have responded to fire-related calls at the encampment about 80 times since last March.

articles.title: ‘I waited, I trusted’: B.C. woman with terminal cancer says health-care system needs help
articles.description: Sara Gilooly said at a press conference on Wednesday that while waiting for tests to be performed, her cancer spread from her breasts to her lungs and her bones.

articles.title: Oil Steadies as Greenland Ruckus Fades and Supplies Tick Higher
articles.description: Oil steadied as geopolitical tensions over Greenland cooled, aiding wider markets and offsetting an array of issues over supply.

articles.title: Saskatchewan beef producers call restored exports to China ‘great news’
articles.description: Cattle producers in Saskatchewan are welcoming the news that China is now accepting Canadian beef after a multi-year ban, saying it will add stability to their industry.

articles.title: Edmonton mayor calls out those allegedly harassing, threatening City workers
articles.description: Edmonton’s mayor, Andrew Knack, is calling out Edmontonians for allegedly harassing and threatening City workers. articles.title: ‘It was all gone’: Calgary mom warns families after YMCA locker thefts
